title: Ways to Reduce ping? for internet providers.
body: So idk who will see this. I sit at around 43 ping in game. which isn't bad but its still some ping you know. This is more out of curiosity with the recent video that was posted on league on this topic. My buddy who is on a college campus out of state has a ping of 3. Now I find that crazy. I saw on that video that riot has some Direct lines with internet providers, but I don't know which ones, and I'm curious if my provider has that. Or if there is anything on my end I can do. I have Comcast as an internet provider and have a hardline connection to my computer. The ping is steady, but is there really a way to reduce it on my end?

replies.body:
Your latency at this point is determined by your ISP routing to our servers. The decisions that your ISP and their partners make in how to route your connection directly affects how long it takes for your connection to hit our servers. This means that there is little you can directly do to affect your latency to our servers, however, reaching out to your ISP may be a good idea. You can find a list of ISPs that we've peered with (in NA) [**here.**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/210665503-NA-Peering-Partners) Additionally, you can view our current Peering Policy in [**this article.**](http://www.riotgames.com/peering-policy)

If you have any other questions, let me know.

Thank you for getting back to me on this topic. I see Comcast xfinity is on your ISP peer list so I would think the ping would be even less if they have already done this. Could it be due to a firewall through windows or Norton internet security that slows the package in transit? It seems there is little I can do to reduce ping, but I wanna make sure I do what I can to get the package in transit as fast as possible. Just have had a hard time knowing what to do.

The best thing you can do to ensure your connection settings are compatible with League is to work through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues), as this will ensure as few things can conflict with League as possible. Almost everything outside of these settings is handled by your ISP, so if you have any further questions about your latency to our servers after working through this guide, it would be best to contact your ISP's support team.

I hope this helped!
also for a little more information. The internet service I have is average 90mb/s and when doing the average speedtest (through at least my provider) it shows 9ms Ping.
